name: GameAssist
description:
GameAssist is a modular Roll20 API automation suite for D&D 5E (2014 Character Sheet; not yet tested on 2024).

It streamlines DM workflow with hot-reload modules for crit fumbles, NPC death markers, concentration checks, and automatic HP rolling, all managed by a stable event queue and in-chat config (no sandbox reloads needed).

Requirements:
- Roll20 Pro (API access)
- TokenMod (from Mod Library, must be installed above GameAssist in API order)
- 7 Rollable Tables (case-sensitive): CF-Melee, CF-Ranged, CF-Thrown, CF-Spell, CF-Natural, Confirm-Crit-Martial, Confirm-Crit-Magic

After installing GameAssist.js and TokenMod, create these Rollable Tables in the Collection tab. CritFumble and confirmation features will not work until tables exist and are correctly named.

Use !ga-status to check module readiness; modules show Ready only if requirements are met.

Core commands:
  - !ga-enable <Module>
  - !ga-disable <Module>
  - !ga-config list|get|set|modules
  - !npc-hp-all
  - !npc-hp-selected
  - !concentration
  - !cc
  - !npc-death-report
  - !critfail
  - !critfumble help

Core modules:
- CritFumble (customizable fumble results via Rollable Tables)
- NPCManager (automated dead marker management for NPCs)
- ConcentrationTracker (auto concentration checks and markers)
- NPCHPRoller (rolls and sets HP)

Most features require TokenMod for marker automation. Missing TokenMod will limit functionality.

For full documentation, detailed setup, troubleshooting, and sample Rollable Table entries, visit https://github.com/Mord-Eagle/GameAssist/blob/main/README.md

To report issues or request features, use https://github.com/Mord-Eagle/GameAssist/issues

Changelog:
- v0.1.1.1: Quiet-startup flag, improved log output
- v0.1.1.0: Initial public release

If a module is not working, check Rollable Table names and TokenMod install order, then see the README or open an Issue on GitHub.
conflicts: Other scripts that modify NPC HP or use bar1_value
